sentences: Tema õppeedukus on halvim kogu klassis.
context: "Halvim" is the superlative form of the Estonian adjective "halb" (bad). It follows the -im suffix pattern used for forming superlatives in Estonian. The word means "the worst" or "most bad" when comparing things to find which has the lowest quality, poorest performance, or most negative characteristics. In the example sentence "Tema õppeedukus on halvim kogu klassis," it means "His academic achievement is the worst in the entire class." The word can be used for various contexts - academic performance, product quality, moral character, health conditions, or any situation where something is being evaluated as having the most negative qualities compared to others.
